body_html:
Ok, my idea made sense in theory. In practise, Travis of course spins up a new environment for each job - so the overall time for the build is of course way longer then just running everything sequentially 😹 (at least of our rather simple setup)

But yeah, otherwise what you say @F3PiX - I'd like to switch the order for the normal Travis setup. Plus I'm going to clean up the .travis.yml file, it's a bit cluttered and actually neither valid yml nor valid in Travis' linter https://lint.travis-ci.org/

body:
Ok, my idea made sense in theory. In practise, Travis of course spins up a new environment for each job - so the overall time for the build is of course way longer then just running everything sequentially 😹 (at least of our rather simple setup)

But yeah, otherwise what you say @F3PiX - I'd like to switch the order for the normal Travis setup. Plus I'm going to clean up the `.travis.yml` file, it's a bit cluttered and actually neither valid yml nor valid in Travis' linter https://lint.travis-ci.org/
